casebody.data:
New York Life Insurance Company, Plaintiff v. James Aitkin, as Executor, etc., Defendant. Decided June 30, 1890. The case was tried before the court and a jury. A verdict was ordered for the defendant and the trial judge ordered the exceptions to be heard in the first instance at the general term. Henry G. Atwater, for plaintiff. Johnston & Johnston, for defendant.

Before Truax and Dugro, JJ.

Per Curiam.

The plaintiff’s exceptions are overruled and judgment is ordered for the defendant, with costs.
